DOC.brief_summary: to compare outcome of pyeloplasty in pediatric population less than 6 months in age using an after coming stent versus stentless pyeloplasty.
DOC.brief_title: Dismembered Pyeloplasty With and Without After Coming Stent
DOC.detailed_description: A prospective randomized control study including patients divided into two groups,all patient undergoes dismembered pyeloplasty First group will be with an after coming stent ,Second group will be stentless to compare outcome of pyeloplasty in pediatric population less than 6 months in age
DOC.criteria: Pelviureteric junction obstruction (PUJO) Asymptomatic obstruction with reduced function (less than 3540%) Asymptomatic obstruction with anteroposterior diameter exceed 40 mm Asymptomatic obstruction with deterioration on conservative follow up. Symptomatic PUJ obstruction, e.g. pain, renal mass, fever and stones. Secondary Pelviureteric junction obstruction Solitary kidney Gross pyuria Ectopic kidney Dilated ureter
